initial.title: Step 0: Initial State
initial.description:
FIFO (First In First Out) is the simplest page replacement algorithm.

Core Rules:
- Replace the oldest page (first one loaded into memory)
- Queue order is determined by load time on initialization
- On page fault: Front of queue is victim, new page goes to back
- On page hit: No change to queue order

We have {num_frames} frames with initial pages: {frame_list}

order_queue.title: Step 1: Order Queue by Load Time
order_queue.description:
First, we order the frame queue by load time (oldest first).

This establishes the FIFO order - the frame loaded first will be replaced first.

Queue order (oldest to newest): {queue_order}

The frame at the front of the queue will be the next victim if a page fault occurs.

page_hit.title: Step {step}: Page {page} - HIT
page_hit.description:
Page {page} is requested.

Page {page} is already in Frame {frame_id}.

Result: PAGE HIT - No replacement needed.

Important: In FIFO, a hit does NOT change the queue order. The queue remains unchanged.

page_fault.title: Step {step}: Page {page} - FAULT
page_fault.description:
Page {page} is requested.

Page {page} is NOT in memory.

Result: PAGE FAULT - Replacement needed.

Victim Selection: Frame {victim_frame} (at front of queue, oldest loaded)
Old page {old_page} is replaced with new page {page}.

Queue Update: Frame {victim_frame} moves to the back of the queue.

final.title: Step {step}: Final Results
